name: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. While I found the rooms to be rather average for the price, they were clean. There is so much to do at this hotel that it is tempting just to stay there all day. It is secluded enough to give that private feeling but close to main road access. There really isn't anything to do there at night but it is very close by to Downtown Disney. To me, this is a good place to stay if you really have time to enjoy the ammenities. Otherwise, it is a little too pricey.
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress
I'd go back
reviews.text: Great hotel. I stayed with my wife and 4 year old daughter while we visited The Magic Kingdom. It was a perfect complement to Disney as you could get away to a quieter upscale hotel that was not overrun with children. The location is convenient to MK and good restraunts. Service was excellent, beautiful grounds and pools, and clean nicely maintained rooms.

reviews.title: Only average
reviews.text: I thought the health club was a little small, but friendly staff to answer questions about some of the equipment.

reviews.title: A very nice Hyatt resort
reviews.text: I would consider staying again- curious about Ritz and JW Marriott as well though.

reviews.title: Regency Club
reviews.text: The Grand Cypress is spectacluar, however there's lots of points that let it down. The lobby staff aren't overly friendly, the atmosphere is bland and pretentious and the location is in a distinctly dogdy area.

reviews.title: Problems
reviews.text: I was frankly surprised to see this hotel's overall rating so high, as our group of 25 all had much the same opinion. But upon reading poor reviews, I get there's been a change in the recent past.

reviews.title: Excellent Service
reviews.text: On the positive side - I like the modern decor. Check in was quick with friendly people, champagne is a nice touch. Concierge, bellhops, valet, room service, wake-up call people all polite, friendly, helpful. The landscaping is beautiful.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, great location!
reviews.text: On the negative side -

reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the HRGC
reviews.text: The shower! There's only half a door. No matter how careful we tried to be, every shower led to the floor and bathmat being soaked and water everywhere. No matter how hot the water, and even if the bathroom door is closed, it's still chilly. It's just a bad design. Also, trying to figure out how the shower works is a challenge. There are no hooks to hang bathrobes, and only one very short towel rack.

reviews.title: Gorgeous property, awesome surroundings, great service.
reviews.text: The bathroom/closet door - it's a sliding door, so either the bathroom is closed or the closet is closed but you can't close (or open) both at the same time. It's an accident waiting to happen, and it's annoying.

We are a family of four. The kids are 4 & 8. We stayed there from 4/4-4/9/07 and the service was great. From the second we checked in the bellman Tim was very nice and gave us a tour. The hotel is beautiful. The pools and waterslides were a hit with the kids. They also liked the gameroom. Everything was very clean. The only thing we didn't like was the food so we didn't eat there again. The location is very close to everything. There is an Olive Garden, IHOP, Uno's, Waffle house,McDonalds right around the corner. The list goes on . There's also a 24 hr. Walgreens which was very helpful 2 blocks away. We'd get to Universal in 15 minutes. If you do the hotair ballon ride with Painted Horizon which we loved they meet at Perkins not even 5 minutes away. Overall we had a great experience with Hyatt and will stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved the service

reviews.text: Did not enjoy overall stay because hotel could not accomodate request for connecting rooms (which had been made directly with the hotel at the time of the original booking - was told it "would not be a problem"). However, hotel was booked solid when we checked in and the best they could do was two rooms next to one another. We were two families together, planning to have the preteens and teens in one room, connecting to the room of two adults. Did not feel comfortable with kids in room alone so adults split up -- there was lots of going back-and-forth and doors opening and closing because the kids always wanted to be together. Could have been a much more relaxed stay ..... hotel attempted to make-up for problem by offering us coupons for continental breakfast for one day. However, only available breakfast in restaurant was the $18.95 per person buffet -- the coupons had a dollar value, per the waiter, of $11.00 so we ended-up paying for each person anyway. Money wasn't the issue but showed hotel's lack of concern. Based upon the overall inconvenience, would not stay there again; would rather support a hotel that tries harder to accomodate the guests.
reviews.title: Could not get connecting rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency from March 14-20 and loved the hotel. The pool was awesome (HUGE with hot tubs, water slides, and both heated and unheated sections) and the other amenities were great, too. We used the peddleboats and bicycles, and only wish we'd had more time for kayaking, horseback riding and other activities. Runners will appreciate the jogging trails, and the fitness room is very good, too. Our deal through AAA included breakfast, and that was a big treat: Cascades had a big buffet for the first five days of our stay (why they didn't on the sixth, I don't know), so we started our theme park days feeling very full and happy. The room was comfortable, though the housekeeping was only okay. Our balcony overlooked the lake, so we also enjoyed the view (and could keep an eye on the changing Orlando weather). Importantly, the location was perfect: very close to the Disney parks (and practically around the corner from Downtown Disney) as well as lots of restaurants and shopping, but we definitely felt removed from all the whole hectic environment of the parks, etc. when we were at the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress!

reviews.text: First, I would like to say that this is perhaps the most beautiful property I have stayed at and I have stayed at some beauties. The building and grounds were spotless. The landscaping was tropical, lush, immaculate and adorned with sculpture. The setting, alone on a private lake, was a perfect respite from the congestion of the Disney area. The staff was helpful and very polite. Our room was well decorated, and spotless. The pool area was expansive with a huge free-form pool that included several lounging areas that allowed you many options with respect to sun, action and noise. There were always chaises available and they were extremely comfortable with thick cushions.
reviews.title: Stunning facility, but not perfect

reviews.text: On the down side:
reviews.title: Great grounds and beautiful place
Not practical for Families with Small Children
reviews.text: The Hyatt Grande Cypress is on acres of beautifully manicured grounds with casscading waterfalls, trees and flowers. It is very close to Downtown Disney but because it was built before DTD, there is no conveinent pathway there. You have to go past the front gate onto Apoka and Vineland, walk until you get to Hotel Boulavard. This takes over half an hour to walk. There are no shuttles to DTD and a cab is about $12. For the $22 a day "resort fee" there should be a shuttle that goes there, if only a couple of times a day. The bus that goes to the Disney Ticket and Transportation Centre runs only twice a morning, thats it. It returns twice in the evening only. A cab costs about $25 without tip.

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: The staff is very pleasant and efficent, but you need to ask very direct questions as they are not forthcoming with information. The reason I titled this is because I think the balconies are hazardous for toddlers and small/overactive kids if they're not watched 24/7. The hotel goes very high, 17 stories and the balcony railings (outside the room and inside facing the atrium) are only waist high. This would get very tiring for parents constantly being on alert. If a person is afraid of heights, ask for a groundfloor room or go else where. The "general store" was almost never opened and the nearest sundries/snack store is 7/11 a 5- 10 minute walk from the front gate. If you need milk in the middle of the night or a bag of chips, this is your only option, unless you order very expensive room service. Rooms are a very modern design that has little privacy if you have kids. The shower has only a half glass door, toilet and sink are all in same room. You can't lock the bathroom door!! It has a very strange sliding door that also opens the closet, making it very inconveninent. Everything is a very open, miniumal modern concept that looks great in magazines but really lacks functionality and practicality with kids.

reviews.title: How can we help you?
reviews.text: The pool is beautiful/huge with a waterslide that is open til about 6pm, but is quite chilly (not heated) so if you have little ones that don't have alot of meat on their bones, its way too cold!

reviews.title: Great Golf Course
reviews.text: Thanks to Robert and all the staff we had a great time here in Nov. The pool, lake, boats, golf were a great addition to our Orlando vacation. Our rooms were great, love the hot tubs and pool slides. One tip, do NOT pay extra for Regency Club. Offerings not substantial enough for the price. We used the morning shuttles to Disney parks but took taxis home because did not want to wait for shuttles. Taxi only $20 for minivan for our family. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!!
reviews.text: These guys have got customer service down. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. Efficient curbside and bell services. Superfast check in and check out. Champagne while you check in if you like! Well staffed front desk and concierge. Jorge at front desk made check in a breeze. Bell service was super helpful at check in (and check out). At check in, bellman took initiative to call front desk and instigate a room change/upgrade after smelling fresh paint in our assigned room. Comfortable beds, no problems with room. Inside of hotel in great shape. Pool was very nice as were paddle boats and climbing wall. Especially nice staff member at climbing wall. These folks are trying very hard to make your stay comfortable and earn your business. They succeeded with us. This was our first Hyatt stay and we will be back. Price very reasonable for quality of rooms and service.

The lobby is beautiful complete with parrots , Christmas Tree, Big Monorah, sliding elevators in a beautiful high atrium. The grounds were also quite stunning. The weather was pretty cool this holiday season - mostly in the 60s and low 70s with cool winds so we were not able to use the pools as much as we liked. But the huge pool was unheated so we swam in the heated smaller pool with a smaller slide and used the jucuzzi's as well. The $13pd resort fee covered the pools/newspaper/shuttle service to the parks (universal too) and boats (sail, peddle, kayak, aqua, ) and bikes and family bikes for 4 as well as mini golf-what a deal! Self parking was free.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds. Not many families. Expensive. Cold pool.
Absolutely Beautiful
reviews.text: In sum I recommend this beautiful resort if you are staying in the Orlando area but don't want to be on the Disney Properties or the 3 resorts at Universal.

reviews.title: Good Choice
reviews.text: We always like staying at the Hyatt in Orlando. It is close to the Disney Parks, not far off the highway and not far from Universal and Sea World. It has a convenient location, but once on the large property you really think you are in an isolated area.

reviews.title: Can't Wait To Return!
reviews.text: The hotel lobby has an 18 story atrium with parrots and other birds all around, plenty of landscaping inside and neat glass elevators to watch the view as you go up and down.
The pluses with this hotel are:
reviews.title: Wonderful place!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a golf package. Was a great location and a very nice hotel with a great pool area for kids (although water was pretty cool), and well maintained property. The only downside was the cost - rum and coke $13! Dinner for 2 at the White Horse Tavern $250, with the cheapest bottle of wine they had! So we paid a $10 cab ride and ate and drank a couple of nights at the Hilton which was about 5 mins away. Overall it's a great hotel, just a little pricey.
reviews.title: Great stay - rather expensive

likes.liked: — Staff extremely courteous - really went out of their way to genuinely help with anything

reviews.text: After reading others reviews, I am surprised at the negative comments . Maybe some people go out of the way to find things wrong. My three daughters and I were treated so well, I would not drive in orlando so depended on shuttles and taxi's. The staff was so helpfull in always getting us the least expensive transportation. Our room was great. Maybe a little normal wear and tear, but to be expected from all the travellers and humidity.Yes one pool is not heated, but not freezing, unless Orlando is having a cool snap. During high season all hotels have minor problems. Also the food is on the high end, but a small fridge helps cut costs , a short trip to the market for snacks and drinks really help. We are going back on our next trip. After staying at the Hyatt for 5 days, we went to a very well know hotel in Nassua, the Hyatt put them to shame.
reviews.title: not dissapointed

likes.disliked: — needed an early pick up at universal studios

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i highly recommend this resort! my fiance and i enoyed our stay so much, that we're already planning the next one with the inlaws. service was great, hotel resturants were a bit steep, ($3.50 for A cup of coffee), but food and service was good. it is a theme area, what do u expect. it didnt matter cause right outside the resort, there are many resturants and ull save $$. shuttles to theme parks are convient and right on time also included in resort fee. pool is GORGEOUS and RELAXING many grottos to hide and have privacy in. Next time we go, we're not goin to the theme parks, we're going just to stay and relax and enjoy all that the HYATT offers! LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT!
reviews.title: relaxing, refreshing, and planning my next stay!!!

likes.liked: — POOL, RELAXING ATMOSPHERE, OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES, CONV. TO PARKS
likes.disliked: — SHOWER NEEDS GLASS DOORS NOT CURTAINS, CURTAIN STICKS TO U WHILE SHOWERING :(

reviews.text: My cousin and I met at the Hyatt for a weekend together of rest and relaxation. The property was a perfect for our goals. As others have stated, the grounds were beautiful and the amenities were plentiful.
reviews.title: Hyatt lived up to the hype!

likes.liked: — The beautiful landscaping, pool area, and pina coladas!

reviews.text: Our fourth-floor room was of average size, and we had a beautiful view of the lake. While we were located near the elevator, hallway noise was minimal and outside noise was nonexistent.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay with a Little Hitch

likes.disliked: — Room are not as big as some other resorts

reviews.text: What everyone said about the lobby and the pools are true so I will post a few things I didn't see here before I visited:
reviews.title: Air conditioning connected to motion sensors!

reviews.text: The air conditioning at this Hyatt uses motion sensors. If it doesn't sense any motion after some time it stops cooling the room. This means that the room is blazing hot when you come back after a long day out. I can live with that. But at night, if you like your room to be cool like I do (eg 67 or 68) you are out of luck. It will only turn on when you toss and turn and in my case it never managed to get below 71. However if you complain they will send someone up to disable the sensor. I suggest you do that on the first day if you like to sleep in a cool room.
reviews.title: Loved this outstanding resort....Will definately return!!!!
Awesome!
reviews.text: Another oddity: they won't let pizza guys deliver to the hotel. You have to pay a valet to go get the pizza for you at the security gate a quarter mile away. Therefore, most pizza places won't even deliver there due to the hassle. If you complain they say that it is a 9/11 security thing, but the security gate is just a formality for anyone except for the poor pizza guys -- they just wave everyone through. Sounds like a case of them protecting their profits. This wouldn't be a problem for me except their late late night room service menu leaves a lot to be desired. No pizza after 1 am for example.

The hot tubs in the caves that run 24 hours are amazing adult entertainment. After reading the reviews here I chuckled at all the people who called them "heated pools". They are elongated jacuzzis that seat 12. VERY nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
Unbelievable!!
reviews.text: I booked a one night stay through Priceline ($105 .... others had gotten it for less) due to a late afternoon arrival and got this resort. What a steal. I wished I had booked several days. I expected a less than perfect experience since I wasn't paying the rack rate. Additionally, with Priceline you are only guaranteed accommodations for 2 adults but I was traveling with my spouse and 2 children. This resort was more than happy to fulfill my request for double beds and even provided a rollaway bed (more like an actual twin bed with double mattress), a room with a view of the pool and the Disney fireworks. The room was clean with a good decor. I was offered a free bottle of champagne (My spouse and I don't drink) and the resort fee was waived when I mentioned I was a Hyatt Gold member (free to join). The staff is personable and genuine. All requests were followed up by a call to make sure everything was alright. The grounds are breathtaking (1500 acres) with so many activities (horseback riding, boating, bike riding, basketball, tennis, massages, man-made beach, swimming, jogging trail, and much more. There are several places to eat on site as well as many places to eat close by. We hated to leave, especially my children. We are already planning a return visit.

Stayed there in May, with access to the lounge, which was great for a light breakfast with the kids. We thought to split the trip between this hotel and the other Hyatt at the beach, and loved this one so much that we cut the beach part of the vacation short and came back here.
reviews.title: Our kids loved it

reviews.text: The service was great. The ladies at the lounge were very attentive, remembered our kids names and were very helfpul.
reviews.title: Excellent example of hyatt high standards- shame hotel renovation work wad not mentioned up front

reviews.text: The pool was great, heated with a small side (section that we frequented).
reviews.title: Best hotel experience so far

reviews.text: It was a much cheaper place than others we have been to and the level of service and cleanliness of the rooms and public areas were above our expectations.
reviews.title: Still a Beautiful Place

reviews.text: We did go to Disney for the day and took our own car. It felt like a really long day for our little ones, and frankly the rides were no better than Point Pleasant beach! I will skip Disney for a year or two until the kids are old enough for more rides.
reviews.title: Great time at Grand Cypress
Nice Hotel - Weird Plumbing
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. It was clean and the staff was supurb. I visited on business so I liked the fact that the business meeting rooms were in close proximity to the elevators. I did not go swimming but the pools were very nice. One wrapped around into a cave-like structure and was really cool-looking.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The only thing I didn't care for was the shower. First of all there was only one door which covered half of the tub/shower area so it was very cold. Also, maybe I'm old fashioned but there were so many knobs that I had trouble figuring out how the shower worked. After finally figuring it out, the shower head was one where the water falls straight down (like a rainfall). This was very nice except it didn't protrude very far and I had to stand very close to the wall to rinse off and I kept stepping on the plug so the tub began filling up several times.

reviews.title: Good, but.....
reviews.text: Other than the weird shower experience, it was a very nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great Rooms and a Great Location
reviews.text: Husband and I went to Orlando for a long weekend. We usually stay at a Hilton but wanted to try something else. We loved the Hyatt! The grounds are breathtaking. Hyatt DOES know what customer service means. Everyone was very nice and even housekeeping asked us if we needed anything (while walking in hallway). I did not like the bathroom/closet door. The door doesn't even lock. Overall the room was very nice. The pool is amazing. They had the fire pit burning on Sunday night, made you feel like you were really on vacation! Room service was very good. Ordered from the cafe near the pool, food was okay but expensive. The drinks from the bar (pool area) are very expensive and not good. I returned one drink because it was so nasty I couldn't drink more than one sip. Needless to say, we didn't order any more drinks from that bar. The location of the hotel is in a perfect area. So close to everything. We plan on staying here again.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: The renovated rooms are a big improvement. the hotel is conveniently located for most Orlando attractions, and there is a wide range of activities on site. But:
A real hit and miss hotel...
reviews.title: Maybe yes, maybe no...

reviews.text: 1. From the distance it looks quite run down....miss
reviews.title: Very Pleased!

likes.liked: — The beauty of the pools and grounds

reviews.text: 2. Close up it has beautiful grounds and looks very smart...hit
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: 3. If you want to save some cash then drive up to the hotel, take your bags out and then drive to the self parking lot rather than using valet parking
reviews.title: Terrible Service - Nice Hotel

reviews.text: 4. The check in was smooth and you receive a tour of the hotel and their parrots....hit
reviews.title: Pay More Get Less

reviews.text: In the morning, the first thing we noticed was that we seemed to be the only family there on vacation. This hotel is a convention center so there were convention people (mostly men) everywhere and dressed in business casual or suits. We had self parked and the shortest way to the parking lot was through the convention hall. We felt kind of funny dressed in our "ready for a day at Disney" attire which included sneakers, hats and fanny packs. We realized that this place was not as family friendly as we had hoped. We wanted a place that wasn't overloaded with kids and babies, but this place was nearly all adult.
reviews.title: A Happy Thanksgiving at the Hyatt

reviews.text: Being a Mom, I was surprised to find out that guest laundry meant, give us your first born and we'll wash your undies. Folding is extra! There was no self service laundry which was something I had counted on since we were staying a whole week. Everything in the hotel is expensive. We ate out on the strip every day and night especially since our child is a picky eater and we didn't want to spend a lot on her meal and have her not eat it.
reviews.title: Grand Cypress-----The Best Non Disney Resort----By far
What a place!!!!
reviews.text: The greatest thing about this hotel is that the grounds are simply amazing. From the lobby to the pool, everywhere you look you see the most beautful landscaping and statues. The pool is an attraction all of its own. It has waterfalls and grottos and bubbly hot tubs. Unfortunately the main pool was simply too cold to swim in even when it was 85 degrees out. The pool temp was only 68 and nobody dared go in. There was a smaller heated pool that my daughter got to swim in, but she was really looking forward to the big pool. That was a big disappointment. So I wouldn't recommend the pool after Sept or Oct.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this property for five nights which, for us, is long enough to get a good feel for a hotel.
reviews.title: Kudos for the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress

reviews.text: Our room on the 14th floor was clean, and spacious with a wonderful, comfortable king-size bed. The linens were spotless and soft, but the pillows were heavenly.
reviews.title: It was great!!

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel is above average - everyone is polite, professional as well as friendly. There are a few resident parrots in the hotel lobby that keep the guests amused. I kept an eye on the check-in reception desk throughout my stay, and noticed that all guests were processed quickly, efficiently and courteously.
reviews.title: Bad night at the Grand Cypress
Great Stay @ Hyatt Grand Cypress
reviews.text: The large pool area is landscaped with lush tropical greenery and bright flowers. Part of this pool complex has a heated pool (83 degrees) and an unheated section (77 degrees). The air temp on those days was about 85-90 degrees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food prices at the Hyatt were high, but that was no surprise to us because all Hyatt properties have high-priced food ($12 for pancakes). We always plan ahead and eat off premises.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel we enjoyed it
Hyatt Gold Passport made it possible :)
reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Hyatt Grand Cypress in Orlando. Out of all the Hotels in the area including the Disney Hotels, this one is at the top of my list! The moment I stepped out of my taxi the wonderful service started. The front desk was very welcoming and took care of my every need, from a very early check in to an outstanding room. The lobby is breathtaking. The scent of the rooms are like stepping into a spring garden. The beds are so cozy and comfortable. The amenities are top notch. Then, you step out to see the pool. Words and pictures cannot even describe it. The caves, waterfalls, slides, and a suspension bridge are unbelievable. There are great hammocks along the beach of the lake that entice you to try it out. There are beautiful trails throughout the property that make you want to take a stroll. The restaurants are Great! The whole complex was extremely spotless!

reviews.title: Family getaway
reviews.text: I will definately recommend and stay here again!

reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, but not convenient
reviews.text: Only 1 Major downfall. The ice chilling temperature of the pool. It is a shame to not see guests really enjoy the pool. There was only 4 brave souls in the pool over the 2 day period I was there. Only one little section is heated. I surely hope that they consider heating the rest of the pool. When I was there in late April the pool was 61 degrees.

There is only one thing that wasn't perfection...the ongoing road construction on SR535 and on Vista Way(? - I'm not sure of the name, but it's the road that you access the Hyatt from...sorry) is still that...*ongoing*. The wait to turn off of 535 onto "Vista"(?) can be several lights long, plus the road construction outside the Hyatt entrance still has that road torn up. The road construction is not a dealbreaker...just something to keep in mind, especially if you have a rental car. I'm sure that once all the construction is finished that easy access will be restored.
reviews.title: So-so as a convention center

reviews.text: Make sure you make the time to tour the grounds. The artworks sprinkled throughout the resort, both indoors and out, are beautiful and the plantings could have come straight off of a magazine cover. If folks like orchids, this is the place to see them - I have never seen so many gorgeous orchids. They have programs for kids, plus the resort fee includes practically *all* the activities - health club with free weights/machines/nice facilities, canoeing, kayaking, paddleboats, bikes, surrey bikes, room coffee service, sailboating, daily newspaper, Executive pitch 'n' putt golf, shuttle bus service...practically the only things the resort fee doesn't include are the championship golf courses(including one that was designed by Jack Nicklaus!) and horseback riding.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt is still "Grand"

aka: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress Hotel Orlando
description: Discover one of Orlando's most inviting escapes, Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. The outstanding array of resort amenities filling our resort creates an amazing retreat for families and business travelers, alike. Play golf and tennis, swim, sail, or treat yourself to a massage. Savor a meal prepared by our renowned chefs – cuisine ranges from authentic southwestern fare to fresh sushi and a sumptuous American buffet breakfast daily. Our family-friendly resort offers an ideal location adjacent to Disney World – kids of all ages will love exploring area attractions. When it comes time to relax, return to our resort, where you always find legendary Hyatt service and smiling staff waiting to welcome you.
